intro: Pfaffia tuberosa, commonly known as curaçao root, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces tuberous roots that are rich in compounds such as curcuminoids, which are believed to have medicinal properties. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its potential health benefits, Pfaffia tuberosa has gained attention in traditional and alternative medicine practices.
